alert.note: Alert for Fauquier; Loudoun; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:19PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LOUDOUN...NORTH CENTRAL FAUQUIER AND NORTHWESTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 419 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Arcola, or near Brambleton, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... South Riding, Brambleton, Haymarket, Arcola, Gainesville, Catharpin, Aldie, Woolsey, and Broad Run. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
